info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 6:36PM CDT until April 15 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Madison County in southwestern Illinois... Southwestern Macoupin County in southwestern Illinois... Southeastern Jersey County in southwestern Illinois... Northeastern St. Charles County in east central Missouri... Northeastern St. Louis County in east central Missouri... * Until 715 PM CDT. * At 635 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Grafton to near Portage Des Sioux to St. John, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported quarter sized hail in St. Peters and St. Charles, Missouri. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Florissant, Alton, Hazelwood, Ferguson, Godfrey, Overland, Jennings, St. Ann, Bridgeton, Bellefontaine Neighbors, Wood River, Bethalto, Berkeley, Olivette, Black Jack, St. John, Dellwood, Normandy, Woodson Terrace, and Bel-Ridge. This also includes Confluence State Park and Beaver Dam State Park. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Illinois...and east central Missouri.
